turns.input: No link—just tell me what it says / the exact details.
turns.expected_output:
No—EBITDA is not the same as operating cash flow. EBITDA is an earnings metric that excludes interest, taxes, depreciation, and amortization, while operating cash flow reflects actual cash movements and includes working-capital changes and other non-cash adjustments.

A common divergence: a company can have strong EBITDA but weak operating cash flow if receivables or inventory increase materially. If you share a simple income statement and working-capital movements, I can walk through an example calculation.
